Kedia, P. R. Panda published in ACM TODAES more Preeti Ranjan Panda Prof. Anshul Kumar Chair Professor Dept. of Computer Sc. & Engg. and School of IT, IIT Delhi MARG: Memory and embedded Architectures Research Group I am a Professor of Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Delhi, and Associated Faculty of the Khosla School of Information Technology. My research interests are in the areas of: Embedded Systems and Computer Architecture Cache and Memory Technologies AI/ML Hardware and Systems Digital Design and Automation Our research group investigates several research problems that arise at the intersection of Embedded Systems and the adjacent areas of Computer Architecture, Compilers, and Systems-on-Chip design. How do we save energy while not sacrificing performance in computing systems? How do we restructure data and computation to address power and thermal issues? What are the system-level implications of emerging memory technologies? Lecture Videos Synthesis of Digital Systems Lecture videos for online course. Books Power-efficient System Design Preeti Ranjan Panda, Aviral Shrivastava, B. V. N. Silpa, Krishnaiah Gummidipudi Springer, New York, 2010.
